abstract: Intel’s $7.7 billion deal to buy the security firm McAfee is a surprising gamble when hardware and software makers don’t often crossover successfully.
snippet: Intel’s $7.7 billion deal to buy the security firm McAfee is a surprising gamble when hardware and software makers don’t often crossover successfully.
lead_paragraph: Intel’s $7.7 billion deal to buy the security firm McAfee is a surprising gamble. Mobile devices are the chip industry’s future, and Intel has fallen behind. It is betting that combining McAfee’s security software with its hardware will give it a leg up. But investors who knocked down Intel’s shares are rightly skeptical the chip maker can pull it off.

headline.main: For Intel, a Merger Of Fish and Fowl
headline.print_headline: For Intel, a Merger Of Fish and Fowl
